definition: room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: I've just been to the lavatory.
sentences.chinese: 我刚去过盥洗室梳洗了一番。

sentences.english: He laid that case aside then he went to the lavatory to wash his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把案件搁置一边然后去盥洗室洗脸。

sentences.english: The cloakroom where you can hang your coat or leave your bags is just behind us here.
sentences.chinese: 盥洗室可以挂包或者把包放在我们我们这。

sentences.english: Myrtle haunts a girls' bathroom on the second floor.
sentences.chinese: 桃金娘经常出没在二楼的一间女盥洗室。

sentences.english: It is leaking, so the washroom floor is full of water now.
sentences.chinese: 管子漏水，所以盥洗室的地上满都是水。

sentences.english: Bathrooms should be designed around people.
sentences.chinese: 盥洗室的设计应以人为本。

sentences.english: Air Conditioning, Ensuite Bathroom, Hair Dryer, Satellite TV, Telephone.
sentences.chinese: 吹风机，房间内带盥洗室，电话，空调机。

sentences.english: B:I've just been to the lavatory.
sentences.chinese: 我刚去过盥洗室梳洗了一番。

sentences.english: She tarted up in the Ladies.
sentences.chinese: 她在女盥洗室里浓妆艳抹了一番。

sentences.english: There are washrooms in every carriage of the train for passengers to wash their faces and rinse their mouths.
sentences.chinese: 火车上的盥洗室设在每节车厢之间，供旅客洗漱使用。

sentences.english: If you die down there, you're welcome to share my toilet.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在下面死了，欢迎你来与我分享这个盥洗室。

sentences.english: And shopkeepers let her use their telephones and bathrooms.
sentences.chinese: 店主让她使用自己的电话和盥洗室。

sentences.english: AN open tap in the wash room filled a basin to overflowing.
sentences.chinese: 盥洗室里的水龙头开着，水不断溢出水盆。

sentences.english: The exploiter soiled the boiling oil in the toilet.
sentences.chinese: 剥削者在盥洗室里弄脏了沸腾的油。

sentences.english: Take a few trips to the water fountain or bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 把去饮水处或者盥洗室当作一次休息。

sentences.english: “Just having a second bathroom feels luxurious,” he said.
sentences.chinese: “连第二间盥洗室都是奢侈的，”他说道。”
